The following procedure describes the determination of 3' terminal nucleosides in yeast tRNA<sup>Phe</sup> and mouse piRNAs as described previously<sup>5</sup>. This method can be applied to any RNA molecule that does not possess a 3'-phosphate at its 3' terminus.

body.body: Dissolve >0.8 µg of yeast tRNA<sup>Phe</sup> or mouse piRNAs in 13.4 µl of Milli-Q water.
Add 1.6 µl of 500 mM ammonium acetate buffer \(pH 5.3) and mix gently
Add 5 µl of 5 units/ml RNase T<sub>2</sub> and mix gently
Incubate the mixture at 37 °C for 3 hours.
Analyze the hydrolysate by using the LC/MS system
